ai-atk-s0203a4:108_0: “How do you meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive?
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_1: If he makes one of the elements because of loving-kindness in all the elements, he meditates perceiving the repulsiveness of the elements in the unrepulsive, and he meditates perceiving the repulsiveness of the elements.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_2: How do you meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive?
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_3: They meditate observing the ugliness of others in what is impermanent, they meditate perceiving the repulsive in both the unrepulsive, and perceiving the repulsiveness of it.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_4: And how does one meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive?
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_5: he makes it happy and satisfied by loving-kindness, and including the elements;
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_6: That’s how the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_7: And how does someone meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive?
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_8: So they meditate observing the ugliness of others, and perceiving the repulsiveness of both in this way. They meditate observing the repulsive and the unrepulsive, and they meditate perceiving the repulsiveness of food.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_9: And how does one meditate equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive?
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_10: It’s a mendicant who, when they see a sight with their eyes, is neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_11: When they know a thought with their mind, they’re neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-atk-s0203a4:108_12: Thus, equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.”
